item.title: Iterate with index in clojure
item.description: Scenario: iterate a sequence (seq) with its index The lines have an implicit line number (starting by 1, in most editors): [1] line1 [2] line2 [3] hello When you read it from file to a variable, it is converted to: ("line1" "line2" "hello") This implicit line number value is not present, therefore you need to assign them one. In ruby, you have this construct: array = ["A", "B", "C"] array.each_with_index {|val, index| puts "#{val}=> #{index}" } Source
